title: A Didone I can't quite place!
content: Hello all, I've recently acquired a beautiful monograph of Dan Winters', released last year by Aperture. The book is set with a very beautiful didone face that I can't quite put my finger on. What's mostly giving me fits is the swash style in the italics. A [cover](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226141619/http:/www.spd.org/0809WIFFDANW611.jpg) image and [interior spread](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226141619/http:/www.spd.org/images/blog/0809WIFFDANW586.jpg), for your consideration. Many thanks!
author: ebspoony

comments.content: FYI there are much bigger images [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100226141619/http:/www.spd.org/2009/06/the-making-of-periodical-photo.php). I couldn't ID by sight, and Identifont, WhatTheFont, and the Serif Font ID Guide didn't get me an exact match.
